text.section: In Part II of this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Charged" means to be the subject of an indictment, an information, or a petition alleging a delinquent act.
"Health officer" has the meaning stated in § 1-101 of the Health - General Article.
"HIV" means any human immunodeficiency virus that causes Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS).

section.section: "Prohibited exposure" means a crime or delinquent act that may have caused or resulted in exposure to HIV.

"Prohibited exposure" includes:
contact that occurs on penetration, however slight, between the penis and the vulva or anus; and
contact between the mouth and the penis, vulva, or anus.
"Victim" means the victim of a prohibited exposure.

"Victim" includes:
a law enforcement officer who is exposed to HIV while acting in the performance of duty;
a paid or volunteer firefighter, an emergency medical technician, or rescue squad member who is exposed to HIV while acting in the performance of duty; and
a forensic scientist, working under the direction of a law enforcement agency, who is exposed to HIV while acting in the performance of duty.

text.section:
"Victim's representative" means:
the parent of a victim who is a minor;
the legal guardian of a victim; or
the person authorized to give consent for the victim under § 5-605 of the Health - General Article.
